alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Cleveland; Jefferson; Lincoln; Lonoke; Prairie; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 11:49PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cleveland, south central Prairie, southern Lonoke, Grant, northeastern Dallas, Jefferson, southeastern Saline, northwestern Lincoln, northeastern Hot Spring, southeastern Pulaski and northwestern Arkansas Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1148 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sisemore to near Scott to Geyer Springs to near Haskell. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Pine Bluff... Benton... Bryant... Downtown Little Rock... Stuttgart... Sheridan... Lonoke... Southwest Little Rock... White Hall... Haskell... Shannon Hills... England... Carlisle... Wrightsville... Redfield... Altheimer... Humphrey... Traskwood... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Arkansas; Cleveland; Jefferson; Lincoln; Lonoke; Prairie; Pulaski; Saline
